con:interface.name: Railkit API
con:interface.con:description:
## Overview Amadeus RailKit is a REST API that manages the whole flow of rail reservations.
### Top resources * Travel-offer * Calendar overview search * Itineraries search * Travel-offers search * Travel-offers day overview search * Accommodations search * Ancillaries search * Cart * Order * Document * Ticket * Financial transaction * StationTimetable
#### Travel-offer A travel-offer is a resource bundling two other resources - offers and one itinerary served by these offers. It allows the displaying of these two resources in a logical way. When a travel-offers search or day overview search are created, travel-offers will be returned in the response. Details of one travel-offer (the details of all the offers and the itinerary it contains) can be requested. ##### Offer An offer is a cohesive bundle of admissions, accommodations and ancillaries which corresponds to a global sellable solution for specified itinerary and travelers. ##### Itinerary Itineraries are returned by Journey Planner. An itinerary refers to one of the possible solutions that fulfill the search criteria of the performed request. It only applies to one way - either outbound or inbound - and it is composed of segments.
#### Calendar overview search A calendar overview search is used to retrieve the best prices per day for a given origin/destination pair on an interval that can go up to 90 days. It provides an overview of the lowest price only per each day for the requested period. It is important to highlight that only the prices are returned and not the details of the offers, so no booking (reservation) can be performed after using only the price returned by the calendar overview. If no end date is provided, the default result covers 30 days. By default the results will be given per travel class. It is possible however to specify the desired travel class(es) in the input so as to filter the shown results. The request can be made for one or two travelers by providing their birth dates in order to define their type - youth, adult or senior. If no date of birth is provided, the default is one adult. Reduction or corporate cards are not supported.
#### Itineraries search An itineraries search is used in a schedule driven flow. An itinerary will be linked to an offer and when a collection of offers is built, the itineraries are retrieved from Journey Planner or built from the information returned directly from the provider.
#### Travel-offers search A travel-offers search is used to retrieve travel-offers for a given origin/destination pair and a specific departure (or arrival) time for one or several travelers. Different input options are supported as, for example, journey options in which the traveler can choose the wished number of connections, vehicle type and so on. Also, product options can be provided. Moreover, travelers entitled to reductions can include them in the request. The travel-offers search bundles the criteria and the results corresponding to the criteria in its response. When creating the search via a cartID, the travelers information will be taken from the cart. If neither a cartId nor a traveler is specified the search is created for one adult without reductions.
#### Travel-offers day overview search A travel-offers day overview search is used to retrieve only the offers containing the best price per itinerary on a day for a given origin/destination pair and a date. An offer returned by a travel offers day overview search can be added to the cart and booked (reserved). As it is a fairly generic request, less input criteria are supported in comparison to the travel-offers search. For instance, only direct itineraries (no connections) are supported and it is limited to two passengers at maximum (without reductions). A travel class and a flexibility level can also be taken into account and in this case the offers returned would be those containing the best prices per schedule solution and flexibility for the travel class chosen. It supports a list of products in input as well.
#### Accommodations search An accommodations search is used for shopping for standalone accommodation. The request can be done either with the origin/destination in input or an itineraryId, if it is known.
#### Ancillaries search An ancillaries search is used to shop for applicable ancillaries based on input criteria. A list of applicable ancillaries is returned, insurances and vouchers, for example.
#### Cart overview A Cart is used for preparing all necessary information to perform a booking. A Cart contains Selected Offers and Travelers. When a cart is checked out, order items corresponding to the cart selected offers are created inside a new or an existing order.
#### Order overview Orders correspond to reservation records (Amadeus PNRs). An Order contains Actors, order items, TicketingOptions, PaymentOptions and PaymentTransactions. An Order is created following a checkout action of Cart, then the Order can be enriched with new cart content or with standalone Ancillaries. An Order contains all reservation details, and can be modified, paid, ticketed, as well as updated by after-sales operations.
#### Document overview Set of information on a file that has been named.
#### Ticket overview The ticket is the proof of representation of the contract of carriage between the contractual carrier and the traveler.
#### Financial transaction A financial transaction is a monetary operation related to a specific order.
#### StationTimetable overview Station Timetables are used to display on websites the equivalent of departure or arrival boards that can be seen in a station. It can be used to retrieve all trains incoming from a particular station; or all trains leaving from a particular station. Lists can be customized to display only trains leaving from/going to particular stations; changing the date and/or filter out trains based on their departure or arrival time.
### Supported operations * Travel-offers * Retrieve the details of one travel-offer * Offers * Retrieve the details of one offer * Itineraries * Retrieve the details of one itinerary * Calendar overview search * Create a search by specifying Origin and Destination to receive best prices. Additional options possible * Create a search with an outward offerId in input to receive inward best prices * Itineraries search * Create an itineraries search by specifying a set of criteria * Scroll on the itineraries received to get earlier/later itineraries * Request real time information when receiving the details of an itinerary * StationTimetable request operations * Retrieve Departure or Arrival Timetable depending on type requested * Travel-offers search * Create a search by specifying Origin and Destination and receive computed travel-offers. Additional options possible * Scroll on the outward travel-offers - earlier/later * Retrieve compatible inward travel-offers * Scroll on the compatible inward travel-offers * Travel-offers day overview search * Create a search by Origin and Destination and receive computed travel-offers. Additional options possible * Create a search with an outward offerId in input to receive inward travel-offers * Accommodations search * Create an accommodation search by specifying Origin and Destination and receive computed offers for accommodation. Additional options possible * Ancillaries search * Create an ancillaries search from an order by specifying the orderId to receive associated possible ancillaries * Create an ancillaries search and retrieve available ancillaries based on input criteria * Cart operations * Create a cart with travelers * Create a cart with offers * Modify traveler information * Add offers in cart * Add optional accommodations in cart * Add optional ancillaries in cart * Select accommodation preferences * Select ancillary (meal) preferences * Remove a selected offer from cart * Remove an optional accommodation from cart * Remove an optional ancillary from cart * Retrieve a cart * Retrieve a selected offer or a collection of selected offers * Retrieve an admission or a collection of admissions * Retrieve an accommodation or a collection of accommodations * Retrieve an ancillary or a collection of ancillaries * Retrieve an traveler or a collection of travelers * Order operations * Before payment * Create an order * Add cart content in an order * Add standalone ancillary in an order item * Add standalone ancillary in a new order item * Add a booker * Modify actor information * Cancel an order * Cancel an order item or a collection of order items * Cancel an admission * Cancel a collection of ancillaries * Retrieve a collection of ticketing options * Select ticketing options * Retrieve a payment option or a collection of payment options * Select payment options * Override ticket time limit * Retrieve a payment transaction * Cancel a payment transaction * Retrieve an order * Retrieve an order item or a collection of order items * Retrieve an admission or a collection of admissions * Retrieve an accommodation or a collection of accommodations * Retrieve an ancillary or a collection of ancillaries * Retrieve an actor or a collection of actors * Search orders with filtering criteria * Create a fee or a collection of fees * Cancel a collection of fees * Document operations * Retrieve a collection of document * Ticket operations * Create a ticket or a collection of tickets * Retrieve a collection of tickets * Financial transactions * Retrieve a financial transaction or a collection of financial transactions
### Limitations * Selected offers in a cart should apply to all travelers in this cart.
### Unsupported operations * Retrieving a PNR which is not created through RailKit is not supported.
## Response structure Every response is contained by an envelope. That is, each response has a predictable set of keys with which you can expect to interact: ``` { "warnings": [...], "errors": [...], "data": {...} } ``` * Warnings
Warnings correspond to non blocking issues encountered when processing an operation.
* Errors
Errors correspond to functional blocking issues encountered when processing an operation. When at least one message has a level 'error' nothing has been processed so no 'data' are returned.
* Data
The data key is the meat of the response. It contains all information regarding the resource requested.
### Projection * Projection is supported only on cart and order messages. * It applies only on GET operations, and on both retrieving a list and retrieving one element. * When having key word "fields" in query parameters, only requested keys are returned in response. * If an inexistent key is used, the key will be ignored. * Only first level members of the response is supported as key. ``` Syntax: GET <path>?fields=<key1,key2> Example: GET /carts/{cartId}?fields=id,totalPrice,expirationTime GET /carts/{cartId}/travelers?fields=id,reductions ```
## Standards
### Date-Time All Date-Time format are represented using the standard ISO 8601 (http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime). ``` Example: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ ```
### Duration All periods of time are represented using the standard RFC 3339 (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). ``` Example: P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S ```

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a standalone accommodation search by specifying a set of criteria. Create a standalone accommodation search

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a search with its travel offers by specifying its id. This method allows the scrolling to retrieve earlier/later travel offers for the same search. In addition, compatible return travel offers can be retrieved. Retrieve an accommodation search

con:parameter.con:name: scrollToken
con:parameter.con:description: Token to scroll and fetch earlier/later travel offers.

con:parameter.con:name: offerID
con:parameter.con:description: If provided, compatible return travel offers will be returned.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to get the saleable ancillaries by providing a set of criteria in input or a reference to the current order and sale on which ancillaries can be offered. Create an ancillary request

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a cart and insert travelers or offers information into it. - If no request body, an empty cart is created. - If the request body contains only travelers information, a cart containing travelers is created. - If the request body contains only offerIds, travelers informations are extracted from offers specified by the offerIds and automatically added into the new cart. Create a cart

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a cart by specifying its id. Retrieve a cart

con:parameter.con:name: fields
con:parameter.con:description: Response projection. Only requested fields are returned in response. Please see global description Projection section.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of selected offers by specifying the id of the cart containing them. Retrieve a collection of selected offers

con:parameter.con:name: fields
con:parameter.con:description: Response projection. Only requested fields are returned in response. Please see global description Projection section.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add an offer or a collection of offers in an existing cart, by specifying its id. Create a selected offer or a collection of selected offers

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a selected offer by specifying its id, as well as the id of the cart containing it. Retrieve a selected offer

con:parameter.con:name: fields
con:parameter.con:description: Response projection. Only requested fields are returned in response. Please see global description Projection section.

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove a selected offer from a cart, by specifying their ids. Delete a selected offer

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of accommodations and all their details by specifying the ids of the cart and the selected offer containing them. Retrieve a collection of accommodations

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add an optional or a stand-alone accommodation, or a collection of both, in specified cart and selected offer. Create an accommodation or a collection of accommodations

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to update a collection of accommodations to select the accommodation preferences. This action updates either successfully all requested items or nothing with an error. Update a collection of accommodations

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove a list of optional accommodations from specified cart and selected offer. If nothing is provided in body, all removable accommodations are deleted. Included accommodations can be removed only by the deletion of the linked admission. If request body contains included accommodation, a warning will be raised. This action deletes either successfully all requested optional accommodations or nothing with an error. Delete a list of accommodations

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an accommodation and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the cart and the selected offer containing it. Retrieve an accommodation

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to update an accommodation to select the accommodation preferences. Update an accommodation

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove an optional or stand-alone accommodation from specified cart and selected offer. Included accommodations are removed by the deletion of the linked admission. Delete an accommodation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of admissions and all their details by specifying their ids, as well as the ids of the cart and the selected offer containing them. Retrieve a collection of admissions

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an admission and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the cart and the selected offer containing it. Retrieve an admission

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of ancillaries and all their details by specifying the ids of the cart and the selected offer containing them. Retrieve a collection of ancillaries

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add optional ancillary(ies) into specified cart and selected offer. Create an ancillary or a collection of ancillaries

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to update a collection of ancillaries to select the ancillary preference. This action updates either successfully all requested items or nothing with an error. Update a collection of ancillaries

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove a list of optional or stand-alone ancillaries from specified cart and selected offer. Included ancillaries can not be removed. Delete a list of ancillaries

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an ancillary and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the cart and the selected offer containing it. Retrieve an ancillary

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove an optional or stand-alone ancillary from specified cart and selected offer. Included ancillaries are removed by the deletion of the linked admission or accommodation. Delete an ancillary

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of travelers by specifying the id of the cart containing them. Retrieve a collection of travelers

con:parameter.con:name: fields
con:parameter.con:description: Response projection. Only requested fields are returned in response. Please see global description Projection section.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a traveler and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the id of the cart containing it. Retrieve a traveler

con:parameter.con:name: fields
con:parameter.con:description: Response projection. Only requested fields are returned in response. Please see global description Projection section.

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to modify the information of a traveler by specifying its id and providing data to update. Update a traveler

con:parameter.con:name: cartId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the cart to be passed in path.

con:parameter.con:name: travelerId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the traveler to be passed in path.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to search for a collection of documents. Retrieve a collection of documents.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a cart and insert travelers or offers information into it. The request body contains only offerIds, travelers informations are extracted from the exchangeTravelRequest. Create an exchange cart

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an exchange cart by specifying its id. Retrieve an exchange cart

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of exchange selected offers by specifying the id of the exchange cart containing them. Retrieve a collection of exchange selected offers

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add an exchange selected offer or a collection of exchange selected offers in an existing exchange cart, by specifying its id. Create an exchange selected offer or a collection of exchange selected offers

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an exchange selected offer by specifying its id, as well as the id of the exchange cart containing it. Retrieve an offer

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove an offer from a exchange cart, by specifying their ids. Delete an offer

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of accommodations and all their details by specifying the ids of the exchange cart and selected offer containing them. Retrieve a collection of accommodations

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add an optional or a stand-alone accommodation, or a collection of both, in specified exchange cart and selected offer. Create an accommodation or a collection of accommodations

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the selected exchange offer.

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to update a collection of accommodations to select the accommodation preferences. Update a collection of accommodations

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove a list of optional accommodations from specified exchange cart and selected offer. If nothing is provided in body, all removable accommodations are deleted. Included accommodations can be removed only by the deletion of the linked admission. This action deletes either successfully all requested items or nothing with an error. Delete a list of accommodations

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an accommodation and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the exchange cart and selected offer containing it. Retrieve an accommodation

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to update an accommodation to select the accommodation preferences. Update an accommodation

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove an optional or stand-alone accommodation from specified exchange cart and offer. Included accommodations are removed by the deletion of the linked admission. Delete an accommodation

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of admissions and all their details by specifying their ids, as well as the ids of the exchange cart and the offer containing them. Retrieve a collection of admissions

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an admission and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the exchange cart and the offer containing it. Retrieve an admission

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of ancillaries and all their details by specifying the ids of the exchange cart and selected offer containing them. Retrieve a collection of ancillaries

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add optional ancillary(ies) into specified exchange cart and selected offer. Create an ancillary or a collection of ancillaries

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to update a collection of ancillaries to select the ancillary preference. This action updates either successfully all requested items or nothing with an error. Update a collection of ancillaries

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an ancillary and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the exchange cart and the offer containing it. Retrieve an ancillary

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove an optional or stand-alone ancillary from specified exchange cart and offer. Included ancillaries are removed by the deletion of the linked admission or accommodation. Delete an ancillary

con:parameter.con:name: selectedOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange selected offer.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a ticket or a collection of tickets in exchange in the order. Create a ticket or a collection of tickets in exchange

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a search for exchange travel offers by specifying a set of criteria. Create a search for exchange travel offers

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a search with its exchange travel offers by specifying its id. This method allows the scrolling to retrieve earlier/later exchange travel offers for the same search. In addition, compatible return exchange travel offers can be retrieved. Retrieve an exchange travel search

con:parameter.con:name: scrollToken
con:parameter.con:description: Token to scroll and fetch earlier/later travel offers.

con:parameter.con:name: offerID
con:parameter.con:description: If provided, compatible return travel offers will be returned.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an exchange travel offer containing the details of an itinerary and its related exchange offers. Retrieve an exchange travel offer

con:parameter.con:name: travelOfferId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the exchange travel offer.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows a customer to retrieve external orders. Retrieve external orders

con:parameter.con:name: owner
con:parameter.con:description: The entity that owns the order, usually a provider.

con:parameter.con:name: externalBookingReference
con:parameter.con:description: The identifier of the record in the external system.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Retrieve all the financial transactions for a given order. Retrieve a financial transaction or a collection of financial transaction

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create an itinerary search by specifying a set of itinerary criteria. Create an itinerary search

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an itinerary search to scroll on its itineraries. Retrieve an itineraries search

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve the details of one itinerary by specifying its id. In addition, real time information can be requested. Retrieve the detail of one itinerary

con:parameter.con:name: realTimeInfo
con:parameter.con:description: To request real time information. By default not returned.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve the details of an offer by specifying its id. Retrieve an offer

con:parameter.con:name: offerId
con:parameter.con:description: Id of the offer to retrieve.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to search orders with filtering criteria. Filtering orders

con:parameter.con:name: travelerLastName
con:parameter.con:description: Filter criteria. Matching path "order.actor.name.lastName" with role "TRAVELER".

con:parameter.con:name: travelerFirstName
con:parameter.con:description: Filter criteria. Matching path "order.actor.name.firstName" with role "TRAVELER".

con:parameter.con:name: maxCreationDateTime
con:parameter.con:description: Filter criteria. Matching path "order.creationDateTime". Result to orders created until the specified value (inclusive).

con:parameter.con:name: minCreationDateTime
con:parameter.con:description: Filter criteria. Matching path "order.creationDateTime". Result to orders created after the specified value (inclusive).

con:parameter.con:name: maxTicketTimeLimit
con:parameter.con:description: Filter criteria. Matching path "order.ticketTimeLimit.effectiveTicketTimeLimit". Result to orders having effectiveTicketTimeLimit until the specified value (inclusive).

con:parameter.con:name: minTicketTimeLimit
con:parameter.con:description: Filter criteria. Matching path "order.ticketTimeLimit.effectiveTicketTimeLimit". Result to orders having effectiveTicketTimeLimit after the specified value (inclusive).

con:parameter.con:name: references
con:parameter.con:description: Filter criteria. Matching path "order.reference.key", "order.reference.value". JSON representation is used on value of this field. Example is as following, references={"customerId":"Value1","customerName":"Value2"}.

con:parameter.con:name: page[limit]
con:parameter.con:description: The maximum items in the result. Default value is "10".

con:parameter.con:name: page[offset]
con:parameter.con:description: The start index of the requested items. Default value is "0"

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create an order by booking a set of offers for some travelers, or by booking the content of a cart, by specifying its id. This method allows also to claim an external order already retrieved. Create an order

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an order by specifying its id. Retrieve an order

con:parameter.con:name: fields
con:parameter.con:description: Response projection. Only requested fields are returned in response. Please see global description Projection section.

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add the content of a cart or an external order in an existing order. This method allows also to add or replace customer remark inside order. Update an order

con:parameter.con:name: orderId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the order to be passed in path.

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to cancel an order, by specifying its id. Delete the order

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of actors by specifying the id of the order containing them. Retrieve a collection of actors

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add an actor or a collection of actors in an existing order, by specifying its or their id(s). Create an actor

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to modify information of actors. Reductions and loyaltyCards cannot be updated. Update a collection of actors

con:parameter.con:name: orderId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the order to be passed in path.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an actor and all related information by specifying its id, as well as the id of the order containing it. Retrieve an actor

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add the content of an exchange cart in an existing order, by specifying the orderId and the exchange CartId. Create an exchange selection with an order item or a collection of exchange order items selected as part of an exchange cart

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an exchange selection by specifying its id, as well as the id of the order containing it. Retrieve an exchange selection

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove an exchange selection from an order, by specifying its id. Delete an exchange selection

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add one or multiple fees in an existing order, by specifying the orderId. Create a fee or a collection of fee in an existing order

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove a collection of fees from specified order. Delete a collection of fees

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of order items by specifying the id of the order containing them. Retrieve a collection of order items

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add an order item in an existing order. Create stand-alone ancillaries in an existing order.

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove a list of order items from an order, by specifying their ids. If nothing is provided in body, all removable order items are deleted. Delete a list of order items

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an order item by specifying its id, as well as the id of the order containing it. Retrieve an order item

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove an order item from an order, by specifying their ids. Delete an order item

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of accommodations and all their details by specifying the ids of the order and the order item containing them. Retrieve a collection of accommodations

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an accommodation and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the order and the order item containing it. Retrieve an accommodation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of admissions and all their details by specifying their ids, as well as the ids of the order and the order item containing them. Retrieve a collection of admissions

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an admission and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the order and the order item containing it. Retrieve an admission

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove an admission from specified order and order item. Delete an admission

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of ancillaries and all their details by specifying the ids of the order and the order item containing them. Retrieve a collection of ancillaries

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to add requested standalone ancillaries into an existing order item, by specifying ancillaries ids and traveler ids. Create an ancillary or a collection of ancillaries

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This method allows to remove a list of stand-alone ancillaries from specified order and order item. If nothing is provided in body, all removable stand-alone ancillaries are deleted. Remove a list of ancillaries

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve an ancillary and all its details by specifying its id, as well as the ids of the order and the order item containing it. Retrieve an ancillary

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This operation allows to retrieve all payment options of an order by specifying its id. Retrieve a collection of payment options

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This operation allows to update a collection of payment options. Payment options can be selected. Update a collection of payment options

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This operation allows to retrieve a payment option by specifying its id. Retrieve a payment option

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This operation allows to retrieve a payment transaction by specifying its id. The payment transaction is a temporary record that will be removed once the ticket is done. Retrieve a payment transaction

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation allows to revert a payment transaction by specifying its id. Delete a payment transaction

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to override the effective ticket time limit with the value defined in field overrideToValue. This operation is allowed only when the field overrideAllowed is true. Update ticket time limit in an order.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a collection of ticketing options of an order, by specifying the order id. Retrieve a collection of ticketing options

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description: This method allows to select a collection of ticketing options for all order items of an order. Update a collection of ticketing options

con:parameter.con:name: orderId
con:parameter.con:description: Identifier of the order to be passed in path.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a calendar search to retrieve the best prices per day in a period given in the input. Create a calendar overview search

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to process the refund for a collection of ticket(s) by specifying the ticket ids and the order id containing them. Refund a collection of ticket(s)

con:parameter.con:name: orderId
con:parameter.con:description: Id of the order containing the requested tickets.

con:parameter.con:name: ticketIds
con:parameter.con:description: A collection of ticket Ids for which refund is requested.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve the refund conditions for a collection of ticket(s) by specifying the ticket ids and the order id containing them. Get refund conditions

con:parameter.con:name: orderId
con:parameter.con:description: Id of the order containing the requested tickets.

con:parameter.con:name: ticketIds
con:parameter.con:description: A collection of ticket Ids for which refund conditions are requested.

con:parameter.con:name: reason
con:parameter.con:description: Reason code to be used for the refund (default PASSENGER_REQUEST) among the possible values STRIKE, PASSENGER_REQUEST, APPROVED_BY_PROVIDER, OPERATOR_ERROR, EQUIPMENT_FAILURE and MANUAL_OVERRIDE.

con:parameter.con:name: refundWithoutRelease
con:parameter.con:description: Option to enforce the refund with pre-computed refund conditions in the situation of an inventory failure.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to process the refund for a collection of ticket(s) by specifying the ticket ids and the order id containing them. Refund a collection of ticket(s)

con:parameter.con:name: orderId
con:parameter.con:description: Id of the order containing the requested tickets.

con:parameter.con:name: ticketIds
con:parameter.con:description: A collection of ticket Ids for which refund is requested.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to get station timetables by specifying a set of station timetable criteria in input. Get stationtimetables matching input criteria.

con:parameter.con:name: stationTimetableType
con:parameter.con:description: Indicates if it is a departure or arrival timetable. Departure timetable lists trains that are departing from the referenceStation. Arrival timetable lists trains that arrive at the referenceStation.

con:parameter.con:name: referenceStation
con:parameter.con:description: Correspond to the station for which you request the timetable. Only 1A code supported.

con:parameter.con:name: direction
con:parameter.con:description: If filled, the timetable will include only trains that are going through this station. Only 1A code supported.

con:parameter.con:name: transportType
con:parameter.con:description: Code (codelist TCS) of the transport type.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to search for a collection of tickets. Retrieve a collection of tickets.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a ticket or a collection of tickets in the order. Create a ticket or a collection of tickets

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a ticket by specifying its id. Retrieve a ticket

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a search for the best travel offers in one day by specifying a set of criteria. Create a search for the best travel offers on a day

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method allows to create a search for travel offers by specifying a set of criteria. Create a search for travel offers

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a search with its travel offers by specifying its id. This method allows the scrolling to retrieve earlier/later travel offers for the same search. In addition, compatible return travel offers can be retrieved. Retrieve a travel search

con:parameter.con:name: scrollToken
con:parameter.con:description: Token to scroll and fetch earlier/later travel offers.

con:parameter.con:name: offerID
con:parameter.con:description: If provided, compatible return travel offers will be returned.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method allows to retrieve a travel offer containing the details of an itinerary and its related offers. Retrieve a travel offer

con:parameter.con:name: realTimeInfo
con:parameter.con:description: To request real time information. By default not returned.

con:config.script:
import java.security.* import groovy.json.JsonBuilder
String lssUserId = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssUserId}' ) String lssOrganization = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOrganization}' ) String lssOfficeId= context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOfficeId}' ) String lssPassword = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssPassword}' )
def shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, passwordP){ shaPwd = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") shaPwd.update(passwordP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") result.update(nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(timestampP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(shaPwd.digest()); return result.digest().encodeBase64() }
def regenerateToken(lssOrganizationP, lssOfficeIdP, lssUserIdP, lssPasswordP){ nonceP = UUID.randomUUID().toString() nonceP64 = nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64().toString() TimeZone.setDefault(TimeZone.getTimeZone('UTC')) today= new Date() timestampP = today.format("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'") saltedPwd = shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, lssPasswordP) json = new JsonBuilder() json ( "userId": lssUserIdP, "organization": lssOrganizationP, "officeId": lssOfficeIdP, "nonce": nonceP64, "timestamp": timestampP, "password": saltedPwd.toString() ) jsonToken = json.toString() return "1AAuth " + jsonToken.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64() }
lssLogin = regenerateToken(lssOrganization, lssOfficeId, lssUserId, lssPassword)
testRunner.testCase.setPropertyValue( "lssLogin", lssLogin)
log.info(lssLogin)

import java.security.* import groovy.json.JsonBuilder
String lssUserId = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssUserId}' ) String lssOrganization = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOrganization}' ) String lssOfficeId= context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOfficeId}' ) String lssPassword = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssPassword}' )
def shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, passwordP){ shaPwd = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") shaPwd.update(passwordP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") result.update(nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(timestampP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(shaPwd.digest()); return result.digest().encodeBase64() }
def regenerateToken(lssOrganizationP, lssOfficeIdP, lssUserIdP, lssPasswordP){ nonceP = UUID.randomUUID().toString() nonceP64 = nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64().toString() TimeZone.setDefault(TimeZone.getTimeZone('UTC')) today= new Date() timestampP = today.format("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'") saltedPwd = shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, lssPasswordP) json = new JsonBuilder() json ( "userId": lssUserIdP, "organization": lssOrganizationP, "officeId": lssOfficeIdP, "nonce": nonceP64, "timestamp": timestampP, "password": saltedPwd.toString() ) jsonToken = json.toString() return "1AAuth " + jsonToken.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64() }
lssLogin = regenerateToken(lssOrganization, lssOfficeId, lssUserId, lssPassword)
testRunner.testCase.setPropertyValue( "lssLogin", lssLogin)
log.info(lssLogin)

import java.security.* import groovy.json.JsonBuilder
String lssUserId = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssUserId}' ) String lssOrganization = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOrganization}' ) String lssOfficeId= context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOfficeId}' ) String lssPassword = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssPassword}' )
def shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, passwordP){ shaPwd = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") shaPwd.update(passwordP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") result.update(nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(timestampP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(shaPwd.digest()); return result.digest().encodeBase64() }
def regenerateToken(lssOrganizationP, lssOfficeIdP, lssUserIdP, lssPasswordP){ nonceP = UUID.randomUUID().toString() nonceP64 = nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64().toString() TimeZone.setDefault(TimeZone.getTimeZone('UTC')) today= new Date() timestampP = today.format("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'") saltedPwd = shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, lssPasswordP) json = new JsonBuilder() json ( "userId": lssUserIdP, "organization": lssOrganizationP, "officeId": lssOfficeIdP, "nonce": nonceP64, "timestamp": timestampP, "password": saltedPwd.toString() ) jsonToken = json.toString() return "1AAuth " + jsonToken.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64() }
lssLogin = regenerateToken(lssOrganization, lssOfficeId, lssUserId, lssPassword)
testRunner.testCase.setPropertyValue( "lssLogin", lssLogin)
log.info(lssLogin)

import java.security.* import groovy.json.JsonBuilder
String lssUserId = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssUserId}' ) String lssOrganization = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOrganization}' ) String lssOfficeId= context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOfficeId}' ) String lssPassword = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssPassword}' )
def shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, passwordP){ shaPwd = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") shaPwd.update(passwordP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") result.update(nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(timestampP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(shaPwd.digest()); return result.digest().encodeBase64() }
def regenerateToken(lssOrganizationP, lssOfficeIdP, lssUserIdP, lssPasswordP){ nonceP = UUID.randomUUID().toString() nonceP64 = nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64().toString() TimeZone.setDefault(TimeZone.getTimeZone('UTC')) today= new Date() timestampP = today.format("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'") saltedPwd = shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, lssPasswordP) json = new JsonBuilder() json ( "userId": lssUserIdP, "organization": lssOrganizationP, "officeId": lssOfficeIdP, "nonce": nonceP64, "timestamp": timestampP, "password": saltedPwd.toString() ) jsonToken = json.toString() return "1AAuth " + jsonToken.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64() }
lssLogin = regenerateToken(lssOrganization, lssOfficeId, lssUserId, lssPassword)
testRunner.testCase.setPropertyValue( "lssLogin", lssLogin)
log.info(lssLogin)

import java.security.* import groovy.json.JsonBuilder
String lssUserId = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssUserId}' ) String lssOrganization = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOrganization}' ) String lssOfficeId= context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssOfficeId}' ) String lssPassword = context.expand( '${Authentication_credentials_for_SHO#lssPassword}' )
def shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, passwordP){ shaPwd = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") shaPwd.update(passwordP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-1") result.update(nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(timestampP.getBytes("UTF-8")); result.update(shaPwd.digest()); return result.digest().encodeBase64() }
def regenerateToken(lssOrganizationP, lssOfficeIdP, lssUserIdP, lssPasswordP){ nonceP = UUID.randomUUID().toString() nonceP64 = nonceP.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64().toString() TimeZone.setDefault(TimeZone.getTimeZone('UTC')) today= new Date() timestampP = today.format("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'") saltedPwd = shaTk1Nonce(nonceP, timestampP, lssPasswordP) json = new JsonBuilder() json ( "userId": lssUserIdP, "organization": lssOrganizationP, "officeId": lssOfficeIdP, "nonce": nonceP64, "timestamp": timestampP, "password": saltedPwd.toString() ) jsonToken = json.toString() return "1AAuth " + jsonToken.getBytes("UTF-8").encodeBase64() }
lssLogin = regenerateToken(lssOrganization, lssOfficeId, lssUserId, lssPassword)
testRunner.testCase.setPropertyValue( "lssLogin", lssLogin)
log.info(lssLogin)
